Import Addresses

Compile all the e-mail addresses of friends you may wish to solicit for their support! You already know that you can can enter e-mail addresses of friends you wish to solicit directly in your Address Book.

You can also import e-mail addresses from the following sources:

  • From Outlook Express

  • From Outlook

  • From Yahoo

  • From AOL

  • From a generic CSV file

How do I import my address book from Microsoft Outlook?

  1. Select "Microsoft Outlook (.csv file)" from the pull-down menu on the upload form in your web browser.

  2. Go to the Microsoft Outlook application on your PC and export your contacts in the .csv file format:

    1. Open Microsoft Outlook 97, 98, or 2000.

    2. Open the File menu and select "Import and Export."

    3. Select "Export to a File" and click "Next."

    4. Select your Contacts folder and click "Next." You might be prompted to install the Microsoft Import/Export Engine. (Outlook 98 users: perform step 'e' first.)

    5. Select "Comma Separated Values (Windows)" and click "Next."

    6. Select the "Contacts" folder to export from and click "Next."

    7. Specify a location on your computer where you would like the file to be saved, and enter a name for the .csv file. Then click "Next."

    8. Make sure there is a check in the box next to "Export Contacts from the Contacts Folder" and tne click "Finish" to export the data to the .csv file.

  3. On the upload form in your web browser, specify the name of your file. Enter the file path and name of the file you exported from Outlook Express, or click the Browse button to find the file on your computer.

  4. Click the Upload Now button and the .csv file will be imported into your address book with all the listed contacts in it.

How do I import my address book from Outlook Express?

  1. Select "Microsoft Outlook (.csv file)" from the pull-down menu on the upload form in your web browser.

  2. Go to the Microsoft Outlook Express application on your PC and export your contacts in the .csv file format:

    1. Open Outlook Express.

    2. Select "Export" from the File menu.

    3. From the Export menu, select "Other Address Book".

    4. Select the file type "Text File (Comma Separated Values)".

    5. Click the "Export" button.

    6. Enter a file location where the file will be saved and enter a name for the file (file name should end in ".csv").

    7. Click the "Next" button.

    8. Check which fields you wish to export. (We recommended checking all boxes.)

    9. Click "Finish" to export the data to the Comma Separated Values (.csv) file at the location you specified.

    10. The .csv file generated in the process above is readable by your Address Book.

  3. On the upload form in your web browser, specify the name of your file. Enter the file path and name of the file you exported from Outlook Express, or click the Browse button to find the file on your computer.

  4. Click the Upload Now button and the .csv file will be imported into your address book with all the listed contacts in it.

How do I Import Addresses from Yahoo?

  1. Select "Yahoo! CSV (.csv file)" from the pull-down menu on the upload form in your web browser.

  2. Go to the Yahoo! Address Book application and export your contacts in the .csv file format:

    1. Go to the Yahoo! Address Book and make sure that you are signed into your account.

    2. Click the "Options" link in the upper-right corner of the Address Book page.

    3. Click the "Import/Export" link.

    4. In the Export section, click the "Export Now" button next to the phrase "Yahoo csv".

    5. When prompted, specify a location where you would like the file to be saved, and enter a name for the .csv file in the "Save As" dialog box.

  3. On the upload form in your web browser, specify the name of your file. Enter the file path and name of the file you exported from Yahoo, or click the Browse button to find the file on your computer.

  4. Click the Upload Now button and the .csv file will be imported into your address book with all the listed contacts in it.

How do I Import addresses from AOL?

  1. Select "AOL 6.0 (.prn file)" from the pull-down menu on the upload form in your web browser.

  2. Export information from AOL:

    1. Open AOL.

    2. Log onto your AOL account.

    3. Go to Mail in the header and select More.

    4. Choose Address Book from the menu.

    5. In the window that comes up, select the addresses you wish to export.

    6. Press the Print button in the Address Book window.

    7. Do you wish to print (export) all addresses or selected addresses only? In the pop-up that displays, check the correct button. Click OK.

    8. In the Print dialog, default printer should be selected and Type should be Generic/Text only. Press OK.

    9. In the Print to File window that displays, specify a location on your computer and a name for the file (file name should end in ".prn") and save the file.

  3. On the upload form in your web browser, specify the name of your file. Enter the file path and name of the file you exported from AOL, or click the Browse button to find the file on your computer.

  4. Click the Upload Now button and the .prn file will be imported into your address book with all the listed contacts in it.

How do I Import addresses from a generic Comma Separated Values (CSV) file?

  1. Select "Generic CSV (.csv file)" from the pull-down menu on the upload form in your web browser.

  2. Build a CSV file containing the names and e-mail addresses of the contacts that you want to add.

    What is a CSV file?

    "CSV" stands for "Comma Separated Values". A CSV file is one in which each line contains one record, and the values within each record are separated from each other with commas. Usually, the name of the file ends with ".csv", but that is not required.

    What does the generic address book CSV file look like?

    In the generic address book that you upload, each line (or record) contains the name and e-mail address information for one person. The comma-separated values in each line are the person's:

    • First name
    • Last name
    • E-mail address

    In addition, the first line of the file is a header line that specifies the names of each column of values. Here's is an example of what such a file looks like:

       First,Last,Email
   Alex,Oliver,alexoliver2001@yahoo.com

    You can download this example CSV file and replace the example record with the names and addresses that you want to upload. Just be careful to keep the first line of data in the file because it is necessary for the import processing. When you are finished, save the file on your computer so that you can upload it from the form on your web browser.

    How do I edit a generic address book CSV file?

    That depends on your computer's operating system and the programs that are available on it. A CSV file may be edited with any editor that creates "plain text" files (these sometimes are named with a ".txt" ending). There are also other programs, such as Microsoft Excel, that can edit the tabular structure (rows and columns) of CSV files in a specialized presentation.

  3. On the upload form in your web browser, specify the name of your file. Enter the file path and name of the file that you created, or click the Browse button to find the file on your computer.

  4. Click the Upload Now button and the CSV file will be imported into your address book with all of the listed contacts in it.
